reviews.text: In my opinion, while the overall experience was acceptable the hotel reflects it age and noise was an issue during my stay. The room was average but not on par with other Courtyard properties I stayed at during the past year. The room seemed a little small and the decor dated. People seemed to be coming into and out of the hotel and various hours, especially in the early morning, which created noise in my first floor room. The breakfast was ample, but again not on par with other Courtyard properties. The staff was friendly and work at keeping the property clean.
reviews.title: Showing a little age and noisy

reviews.text: I stayed here on business during back-to-back weeks in early may. The room quality is, of course, as you would expect. My first room, I felt, was a little on the small side. It had a king bed and a love seat, and I remember thinking that for the size of the room, it actually would have been nice if the room DIDN'T have the love seat.
reviews.title: Quiet hotel, stayed twice, would stay again

reviews.text: During my second stay, they upgraded me to room 250 which is much larger. I definitely appreciated the extra space. I noticed, though, that all day long, I heard just about every step that the person in the room above me made. As matter of fact, I can hear the squeaking of floorboards as I type this. Minor issue, though, and there is never any noise in the late evening.
reviews.title: Nice place to stay, convenient location depending on your destination

reviews.text: The hotel step is very nice including everyone from the front desk personnel to the housekeeping staff.
reviews.title: Good Courtyard

reviews.text: As a solo traveler, I notice that there's not much communing of the guests, so if you want a quiet hotel, this is your place. If you want something more lively like me, downtown Lowell is a hop, skip, and a jump away.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel With An Average Location

reviews.text: I'd rate this as an average courtyard experience, which unfortunately is the best you can expect in the immediate Lowell area.
reviews.title: Pretty much what you'd expect from a courtyard

reviews.text: PLUS: friendly staff makes you feel you are genuinely welcome.
reviews.title: Great Stay

reviews.text: MINUS: wifi is slow. Good for browsing and emails maybe. Forget it if you'd like to unwind with a Netflix movie.
reviews.title: Kicked out at 2 am

reviews.text: Hotel has no restaurant or the deli that many courtyard offers. Dining choices in the vincinity is very limited. (Outback steakhouse anyone?)
reviews.title: I will definitely stay at this Courtyard again!

reviews.text: I am loyal to Hilton but had to stay here due to meetings. Overall a great stay.
reviews.title: Quiet, pleasant stay + great customer support

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel one night during a visit to the Lowell National Historic Park. The rooms are very small, but adequate for a short stay. It's located within 10 minutes of downtown Lowell and an easy on/off the highway, but it's situated in a high density area of big box stores and chains, e.g. Lowe's, fast food jooints. It's an OK place to lay your head but don't expect any ambiance! One further caveat -- the wall are made of paper it seems. We were lucky and had relatively quiet neighbors but it could have been a nightmare! Also, big pool attracts families and lots of kids. Ok if you don't mind shaing the lobby in the morning with wet 10 -year-olds. If I returned to Lowell I'd try to book into the UMass Conference Center instead. We walked by it -- great location in the center of the historic district.
reviews.title: Basic Accommodations

reviews.text: First - if you have mobility issues, think twice. I was traveling with a broken leg. I called ahead to request a shower chair and was told they had no such thing - only fully handicapped-accessible rooms. Those are often very inconvenient for people not in wheelchairs. Access to the restaurant is down stairs - there is a ramp, but it's not at all obvious and I only found it by accident. Most doors open to the outside.
reviews.title: Average at best

reviews.text: The location is good in the sense that it's right off the freeway, but it's not convenient to much of anything - "Industrial Road" is well named. There are no restaurants in walking distance. The hotel mini-mart has mostly snack items and nothing for breakfast (though you can purchase an $8 bottle of wine for $21.)
reviews.title: Great service, small rooms

reviews.text: The rooms are adequate but no more. Bathroom amenities include soap, shampoo, and conditioner (no lotion.) There is no luggage rack in the closet. There are two phones, one by the bed and one on the desk, but they only put a pen and paper next to the one by the bed. Internet is complimentary but painfully slow. There is complimentary coffee but you're only allowed one package of condiments per pot, so unless you drink it black you're probably shortchanged.
reviews.title: Very comfortable and nice hotel

reviews.text: The service at this hotel can't be beat. Staff was friendly and helpful. Overall atmosphere and decor was very polished. Guest rooms were a bit tight, but beds were comfortable and bathrooms were spotless!
reviews.title: Really reliably a courtyard-- recent improvements

reviews.text: Stayed one night on business. Wish this courtyard had been updated with the newer bistro setting. No dinner available, didn't want to go out. Bed was comfy, pillows good, but the rooms could use some sound proofing. You could hear everything through the older doors. Overall not a bad stay, just prefer the newer updated courtyards
reviews.title: Older courtyard, stay was decent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent 2 nights over Labor Day weekend. We wanted to visit Boston and many other properties were sold out or extremely expensive. We've usually had good luck with Courtyards and this looked like a good bet; we weren't disappointed. The room was very clean and we actually slept better than we do at home.
reviews.title: Clean and comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was about a 40 minute drive into Boston to see the sights.
reviews.title: It was what we needed

reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here 1 night. The rooms were clean and the staff was very pleasant. We didn't use any of the amenities because we didn't stay very long. We had a view of the outdoor pool and it seemed nice.
reviews.title: Excellent accomodating management and nice hotel

reviews.text: We recently stayed here while finding an apartment in Boston for my daughter. WeI really liked this hotel. The staff and in particular, the manager, was very accomodating going the extra mile to help us. I would stay there again
reviews.title: Watch out for smash and grab crime!
